meanings.definition: A visual representation of the spectrum of frequencies of a signal as they vary with time.
meanings.sent1: The spectrogram showed how the sound changed over time.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a spectrogram to study different frequencies in a signal.
meanings.sent3: The funny spectrogram made the music look like a colorful rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a spectrogram, with highs and lows throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The spectrogram was like a colorful graph mapping out the sound waves.

meanings.definition: To analyze or produce a spectrogram.
meanings.sent1: I will spectrogram the audio file to see its frequency distribution.
meanings.sent2: She likes to spectrogram music to understand its composition better.
meanings.sent3: He decided to spectrogram the song to see if there were any hidden messages.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to spectrogram the recording to catch the subtle clues.
meanings.sent5: Spectrogramming the data helped reveal patterns that were not visible before.
